artist: Designer: George Washington Maher; Manufacturer: Gorham Manufacturing Company; Retailer: Spaulding & Company, Chicago, Illinois
creditline: Gift of funds from the Decorative Arts Council with proceeds from the 2005 Antiques Show and Sale
description: spatulate-shaped blade; handle decorated with long-stemmed lilies with two flowers and two buds and EKG monogram
markings: on side of handle, stamped: [Martelé/ (eagle)/ (lion) (anchor) G (?)/ 9584]; on opposite side of handle, stamped: [ZGF/ SPAULDING & CO. CHICAGO]; below blade, stamped: [STERLING]
object_name: Luncheon knife, from a twelve-piece place setting
title: Luncheon knife, from a twelve-piece place setting
